page.title: 09INDUSTRY IN SHIPSTON
page.content: {Norgren}are the biggest employers in the Shipston-on-Stour area.They employ 430 people,of whom about 200 live in Shipston.In 1972 Norgren joined the I.M.I.Group to form I.M.I.Norgren Enots Ltd.The firm make air filters for compressors.They made a part for Thrust 2,which,driven by Richard Noble set a new world speed record for a jet-engined car of 615 m.p.h.(989km.p. h.) in 1981. {Tileman}are a civil engineering company.At Shipston-on-Stour they employ 34 people,about half of whom live in Shipston.The working day is from 7.00 a.m.until 6.00 p.m.They sometimes work at weekends.Tileman work in such countries as U.S.A., Canada,Australia,Mexico and Kuwait. They provided the towers for the Humber Bridge in 1973.
